title: Directs commissioner of health and commissioner of mental retardation and developmental disabilities to require pediatric care providers to screen for autism; repealer
summary: Directs the commissioner of health and commissioner for people with developmental disabilities to jointly promulgate rules and regulations requiring pediatric health care providers to screen children beginning at the age of 18 months for autism spectrum disorders during each wellness and preventative care examination.

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the public health law and the mental hygiene law, in
         relation to directing the commissioner of health and the  commissioner
         of the office for people with developmental disabilities to promulgate
         rules  and  regulations  requiring every child beginning at the age of
         eighteen months to be examined for autism spectrum disorders;  and  to
         repeal  section  2500-j of the public health law relating to screening
         children for autism spectrum disorders

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 2500-j of the public health law is REPEALED.
    2    S  2.  The public health law is amended by adding a new section 2500-k
    3  to read as follows:
    4    S 2500-K. PEDIATRIC WELLNESS VISITS;  SCREENING  FOR  AUTISM  SPECTRUM
    5  DISORDERS.  1.  THE COMMISSIONER SHALL, JOINTLY WITH THE COMMISSIONER OF
    6  THE OFFICE FOR PEOPLE WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES, AND ON OR  BEFORE
    7  MAY FIRST, TWO THOUSAND TWELVE, PROMULGATE RULES AND REGULATIONS REQUIR-
    8  ING  EVERY  PEDIATRIC  PRIMARY  CARE PROVIDER, CONDUCTING A WELLNESS AND
    9  PREVENTATIVE CARE EXAMINATION, ON OR AFTER SEPTEMBER FIRST, TWO THOUSAND
   10  TWELVE, OF A CHILD EIGHTEEN MONTHS OF AGE OR OLDER, TO SCREEN SUCH CHILD
   11  FOR AUTISM SPECTRUM DISORDERS.
   12    2. IN ADDITION, SUCH RULES AND REGULATIONS SHALL ESTABLISH  GUIDELINES
   13  AND PROTOCOLS FOR:

    4    (C)  THE  APPROPRIATE  REFERRAL MECHANISM FOR CHILDREN, WHO BASED UPON
    5  THE RESULTS OF SCREENING FOR AUTISM SPECTRUM DISORDERS, REQUIRE  FURTHER
    6  EVALUATION.
    7    3.  IF  THE COMMISSIONER AND THE COMMISSIONER OF THE OFFICE FOR PEOPLE
    8  WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES SHALL FAIL TO PROMULGATE, ON  OR  BEFORE

   11  IMPLEMENT THE RELEVANT FEDERAL RULES AND REGULATIONS RELATING THERETO.
   12    S 3. The mental hygiene law is amended by adding a new  section  16.39
   13  to read as follows:
   14  S 16.39 PEDIATRIC  WELLNESS VISITS; SCREENING FOR AUTISM SPECTRUM DISOR-
   15            DERS.
   16    THE COMMISSIONER SHALL, JOINTLY WITH THE COMMISSIONER OF  HEALTH,  AND
   17  ON  OR  BEFORE  MAY  FIRST,  TWO THOUSAND TWELVE, PROMULGATE ANY AND ALL
   18  RULES AND REGULATIONS REQUIRED BY SUBDIVISIONS ONE AND  TWO  OF  SECTION
   19  TWENTY-FIVE HUNDRED-K OF THE PUBLIC HEALTH LAW RELATING TO THE SCREENING
   20  OF CHILDREN FOR AUTISM SPECTRUM DISORDERS.
   21    S  4.  This act shall take effect immediately, except that section one
   22  of this act shall take effect September 1, 2012.
